description: Alterations and extensions at ground, first and second floor levels associated with the the formation of 5no. new self-contained flats and modification of existing flats at Surbiton Court Mews following the demolition of  2no. garages and a single storey studio (formerly garage)
decision_conditions: The proposed development would have an unacceptable adverse impact upon neighbouring residential amenity by reason of the insertion of windows in the rear elevation at first floor level and the introduction of a balcony to the front elevation at second floor level which would give rise to unacceptable levels of overlooking/loss of privacy regarding properties Nos. 20, 22 and 24 The Mall and the properties at first and second floor level in the eastern corner of Surbiton Court, thereby conflicting with Policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development has failed to incorporate a mix of unit sizes to meet the identified housing needs of the Borough. The applicant has failed to demonstrate that the delivery of 30% of the units as family units would be unsuitable or unviable. As such, the development is contrary to Policy DM13 of the LDF Core Strategy, 2012.

The applicant has failed to demonstrate satisfactory measures to ensure that the three parking spaces proposed in the north-western part of the site could be safely accessed without resulting in vehicular/pedestrian conflict. In the absence of these measures, the proposed development would have an unacceptable adverse impact on highway safety thereby conflicting with policies CS7 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

In the absence of a legal agreement to ensure that future occupants of the proposed development would be precluded from obtaining on-street car parking permits, the proposed development would lead to inconsiderate parking and increase on-street car parking pressure in surrounding thereby conflicting with policies CS7 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The applicant has failed to provide a sufficient number of cycle parking spaces for the proposed development and failed to encourage sustainable modes of transport thereby conflicting with Policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2016 and Policy DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
Condition 3 (Materials), 5 (Cycle Parking) & 11 (Boundaries) - Officers have reviewed the information provided and are satisfied this can now be approved
Condition 7 and 8 (Construction Management Plan) - The Neighbourhood Traffic Engineer has reviewed the information provided and is satisfied this can now be approved

The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that Condition 3 (Materials), 5 (Cycle Parking), 7 and 8 (Construction Management Plan) & 11 (Boundaries) of Planning Permission 18/14085/FUL are hereby fully approved.

Please provide copies of existing and proposed elevations at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing all elevations not just part and indicating all key dimensions for the proposed work.If no changes are proposed this can be in photographic form, accompanied by confirmation that no changes are proposed to the elevations.

You are required to complete the 'Determining whether a Development may be CIL Liable Planning Application Additional Information Requirement form'. This form can be downloaded from the planning portal at https://ecab.planningportal.co.uk/uploads/1app/forms/form_1_cil_additional_information.pdf . Please complete and return as soon as possible.if you have confirmed that the development is Cil Liable, please also complete the Assumption of Liability Form at https://www.planningportal.co.uk/info/200136/policy_and_legislation/70/community_infrastructure_levy/5  and return as soon as possible.

For the sake of clarity please can you list the drawings numbers for the new proposed plans, and the previously approved plans, as many of the plans you have submitted on 16/02/2022 have been duplicated
